content.question: Which of the following statements best explains the significance of portraying both Muslim prayer and traditional West African spiritual amulets in this engraving?

choices.label: The development of syncretic practices in West African societies resulted in the blending of local and introduced cultures.
The rejection of outside influences in West African societies allowed African empires to preserve traditional religious principles.
Increased trade between West African empires and merchants from North Africa contributed to an increase in wealth in both regions.
The isolation of West African empires from North African influence strengthened Islam in West Africa.

content.answer: The development of syncretic practices in West African societies resulted in the blending of local and introduced cultures.
